text: Hi guys I managed to patch together an example using the 'indirectbr' llvm instruction, which is how computed gotos might be implemented.  Does anyone know how to turn this into a macro?

elements.text: Hi guys I managed to patch together an example using the 'indirectbr' llvm instruction, which is how computed gotos might be implemented.  Does anyone know how to turn this into a macro?

text:
```Base.@ccallable Nothing function foo1()
    println("1")
    return nothing
end

Base.@ccallable Nothing function foo2()
    println("2")
    return nothing
end

Base.@ccallable Nothing function foo3()
    println("3")
    return nothing
end

function dofoo(x::Int32)
    Core.Intrinsics.llvmcall(("""
        declare void @foo1()
        declare void @foo2()
        declare void @foo3()
        define i8* @dofoo(i32 %idx) nounwind {
        %labels = alloca [6 x i8*]
        %da = getelementptr [6 x i8*], [6 x i8*]* %labels, i32 0, i32 0
        %db = getelementptr [6 x i8*], [6 x i8*]* %labels, i32 0, i32 1
        %dc = getelementptr [6 x i8*], [6 x i8*]* %labels, i32 0, i32 2
        %dd = getelementptr [6 x i8*], [6 x i8*]* %labels, i32 0, i32 3
        %de = getelementptr [6 x i8*], [6 x i8*]* %labels, i32 0, i32 4
        %df = getelementptr [6 x i8*], [6 x i8*]* %labels, i32 0, i32 5
        store i8* blockaddress(@dofoo, %AA), i8** %da
        store i8* blockaddress(@dofoo, %BB), i8** %db
        store i8* blockaddress(@dofoo, %CC), i8** %dc
        store i8* blockaddress(@dofoo, %DD), i8** %dd
        store i8* blockaddress(@dofoo, %EE), i8** %de
        store i8* blockaddress(@dofoo, %FF), i8** %df
        %brtoptr = getelementptr [6 x i8*], [6 x i8*]* %labels, i32 0, i32 %idx
        %brto = load i8*, i8** %brtoptr
        indirectbr i8* %brto, [label %AA, label %BB, label %CC, label %DD, label %EE, label %FF]
        AA:
        call void @foo1()
        ret i8* %brto
        BB:
        call void @foo2()
        ret i8* %brto
        CC:
        call void @foo3()
        ret i8* %brto
        DD:
        call void @foo3()
        ret i8* %brto
        EE:
        call void @foo2()
        ret i8* %brto
        FF:
        call void @foo1()
        ret i8* %brto
        }
    """,
        """
        %2 = call i8* @dofoo(i32 %0)
        %3 = ptrtoint i8* %2 to i64
        ret i64 %3
    """), Int64, Tuple{Int32}, x)
end

let
    dofoo(Int32(2));
end```

elements.text:
Base.@ccallable Nothing function foo1()
    println("1")
    return nothing
end

Base.@ccallable Nothing function foo2()
    println("2")
    return nothing
end

Base.@ccallable Nothing function foo3()
    println("3")
    return nothing
end

function dofoo(x::Int32)
    Core.Intrinsics.llvmcall(("""
        declare void @foo1()
        declare void @foo2()
        declare void @foo3()
        define i8* @dofoo(i32 %idx) nounwind {
        %labels = alloca [6 x i8*]
        %da = getelementptr [6 x i8*], [6 x i8*]* %labels, i32 0, i32 0
        %db = getelementptr [6 x i8*], [6 x i8*]* %labels, i32 0, i32 1
        %dc = getelementptr [6 x i8*], [6 x i8*]* %labels, i32 0, i32 2
        %dd = getelementptr [6 x i8*], [6 x i8*]* %labels, i32 0, i32 3
        %de = getelementptr [6 x i8*], [6 x i8*]* %labels, i32 0, i32 4
        %df = getelementptr [6 x i8*], [6 x i8*]* %labels, i32 0, i32 5
        store i8* blockaddress(@dofoo, %AA), i8** %da
        store i8* blockaddress(@dofoo, %BB), i8** %db
        store i8* blockaddress(@dofoo, %CC), i8** %dc
        store i8* blockaddress(@dofoo, %DD), i8** %dd
        store i8* blockaddress(@dofoo, %EE), i8** %de
        store i8* blockaddress(@dofoo, %FF), i8** %df
        %brtoptr = getelementptr [6 x i8*], [6 x i8*]* %labels, i32 0, i32 %idx
        %brto = load i8*, i8** %brtoptr
        indirectbr i8* %brto, [label %AA, label %BB, label %CC, label %DD, label %EE, label %FF]
        AA:
        call void @foo1()
        ret i8* %brto
        BB:
        call void @foo2()
        ret i8* %brto
        CC:
        call void @foo3()
        ret i8* %brto
        DD:
        call void @foo3()
        ret i8* %brto
        EE:
        call void @foo2()
        ret i8* %brto
        FF:
        call void @foo1()
        ret i8* %brto
        }
    """,
        """
        %2 = call i8* @dofoo(i32 %0)
        %3 = ptrtoint i8* %2 to i64
        ret i64 %3
    """), Int64, Tuple{Int32}, x)
end

let
    dofoo(Int32(2));
end

text:
It would be cool if I could turn this into a macro like
```@compgoto x foo1 foo2 foo3 foo3 foo2 foo1```

elements.text: It would be cool if I could turn this into a macro like
@compgoto x foo1 foo2 foo3 foo3 foo2 foo1
